DOC.brief_summary: The investigator plan evaluate length time discharge readiness group ( continuous femoral nerve block ( cFNB ) vs. liposomal bupivacaine ( LB ) vs. periarticular infusion cocktail ( PIC ) follow primary total knee arthroplasty ( TKA ) . In addition , investigator compare quadriceps strength recovery time exploratory variable group .
DOC.brief_title: Multimodal Pain Management Following Primary TKA
DOC.criteria: ≥ 40 Years Old Scheduled Primary Total Knee Arthroplasty Opiate Tolerant ( ≥60mg/day oral morphine/equivalent ≥1 week ) Neuromuscular deficit affect low limbs Peripheral neuropathy Radiculopathy/Sciatica Known allergy intolerance Bupivacaine Ropivacaine Hepatic Disease Renal Disease/Patients need Dialysis Planned unicompartmental knee replacement Less 90 degree knee flexion preoperatively . Patients lack capacity consent unwilling At discretion PI , patient may difficulty comply standard care ( SOC ) followup may also exclude
